images.caption:
Figure 1:Contextual integrity (CI) violations in agents arise when they fail to recognize the appropriateness of the sharing of background information for a given context.
We propose a framework that explicitly reasons about the contextual appropriateness of each user attribute.
In this context, the attributes in green are appropriate to share whereas the attributes in red are inappropriate.
In this illustration, the agent correctly uses only the appropriate attributes for completing the task.
